title: Senior Gameplay Engineer, Games Studio
overview: The Senior Gameplay Engineer, Games Studio position involves collaborating with the design team to translate gameplay objectives into technical solutions, implementing core gameplay mechanics, optimizing existing systems, mentoring junior engineers, identifying technical challenges and proposing solutions, resolving gameplay-related issues, and staying updated with industry trends and emerging technologies. The ideal candidate should have excellent problem-solving skills, be skilled at writing elegant and optimized code, and have at least 5 years of professional experience in gameplay development, proficiency with game development engines (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine), and a significant experience using C#.

extras.title: Responsibilities:
content: Collaborate closely with the design team to understand gameplay objectives and translate them into technical solutions.
Partner with design and implement core gameplay mechanics, systems, and features.
Optimize and maintain existing gameplay systems to ensure a fluid and engaging player experience.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior engineers, sharing your expertise in gameplay development.
Identify technical challenges and propose innovative solutions to overcome them.
Debug and resolve gameplay-related issues, ensuring high-quality and bug-free gameplay experiences.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to continually enhance our gameplay capabilities.

extras.title: About you:
content: Driven to maintain the highest-quality experiences for players.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as in a team.
Skilled at writing code that is elegant, extensible, and optimized.
Proficient at giving and receiving quality feedback.
Self-starter willing to seek out solutions and ask questions when necessary.
Mindful of the needs of a team as individuals and as a whole.

extras.title: Skills & Requirements:
content: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
5+ years of professional experience in gameplay development.
Proficiency with game development engines (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine).
Two or more published games for mobile, consoles and/or PC.
